intro: Erythroxylum andrei, commonly known as the Andean holly, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in the Andes Mountains of Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Erythroxylum andrei is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
